@title Calculate day length

Source: R/UtilityFunctions.R
daylength.Rd

Calculate daylength in hours as a function of latitude and day of year. Uses the CMB model (Campbell and Norman 1998) .

daylength(lat, doy)

Arguments

lat

numeric latitude in decimal degrees.

doy

numeric day of year (1-366).

Value

numeric day length in hours.

References

Campbell GS, Norman JM (1998). Introduction to environmental biophysics, 2nd ed. edition. Springer, New York. ISBN 0387949372.

See also

Other utility functions: airpressure_from_elev(), azimuth_angle(), dec_angle(), degree_to_radian(), fahrenheit_to_celsius(), fahrenheit_to_kelvin(), kelvin_to_celsius(), solar_noon(), zenith_angle()

Examples

  daylength(lat=47.61, doy=112)
#> [1] 15.06007
